item.title: KKR支持的OneStream秘密申请在美国上市
item.description: 据知情人士透露，KKR & Co.支持的软件公司OneStream已向美国证券交易委员会秘密提交了首次公开募股申请，可能在几个月内上市。【原文：KKR & Co.-backed software company OneStream has confidentially filed with the US Securities and Exchange Commission for an initial public offering that could come within a few months, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 香港摇摇欲坠的加密货币 ETF 首次亮相削弱了全球枢纽的抱负
item.description: 香港首批直接投资于加密货币的交易所交易基金迄今未能像美国竞争对手的产品那样引发热议，这对香港推动建立卓越的数字资产中心是一个打击。【原文：The first Hong Kong exchange-traded funds investing directly in crypto have so far failed to spark the kind of excitement that greeted rival US products, a blow for the city’s push to foster a preeminent digital-asset hub.】

item.title: 碧桂园将与清算威胁展开法庭斗争
item.description: 碧桂园控股有限公司（Country Garden Holdings Co.【原文：Country Garden Holdings Co. is set to begin a major legal battle on Friday, squaring off in a Hong Kong court against a creditor seeking the liquidation of the defaulted Chinese developer.】

item.title: 应用材料公司业绩预测在股价上涨后不尽如人意
item.description: 美国最大的芯片制造设备制造商应用材料公司（Applied Materials Inc.【原文：Applied Materials Inc., the largest US maker of chipmaking machinery, failed to impress investors with its latest forecast following a rally in the shares this year.】

item.title: 法瑞尔-威廉姆斯支持的冲浪公园项目获得弗吉尼亚海滩资助
item.description: 弗吉尼亚海滩利用市政债券市场，为一个由多次获得格莱美奖的艺术家法瑞尔-威廉姆斯（Pharrell Williams）支持的冲浪公园开发项目提供资金。【原文：Virginia Beach tapped the municipal bond market to help fund a surf-park development backed by multi-Grammy award winning artist Pharrell Williams.】

item.title: 铜、金价格飙升，多伦多股票销售反弹 98
item.description: 在经历了股票销售惨淡的一年后，加拿大最大的交易所因铜价和金价飙升，矿业公司筹集资金而出现反弹。【原文：After a miserable year for share sales, Canada’s largest exchange is seeing a rebound thanks to mining firms raising capital as copper and gold prices have spiked.】

item.title: 意大利 ERG 计划加大对美国可再生能源的投资力度
item.description: 意大利可再生能源集团 ERG SpA 正计划通过有选择性的合作伙伴关系扩大其在美国的足迹，旨在充分利用美国提供的慷慨激励措施。【原文：Italian renewables group ERG SpA is planning to expand its footprint in the US through selective partnerships, aiming to make the most of the generous incentives offered by the country.】

item.title: 金-卡戴珊（Kim Kardashian）的 Met Gala 礼服彰显了一个即将蓬勃发展的市场
item.description: 就在两年前，金-卡戴珊（Kim Kardashian）穿着玛丽莲-梦露（Marilyn Monroe）为约翰-肯尼迪（John F. Kennedy）演唱 "生日快乐，总统先生 "时穿的标志性裸色网纱连衣裙走过大都会晚宴（Met Gala）的红地毯，在网上引起了轩然大波。【原文：It was just two years ago that Kim Kardashian caused a stir online after walking down the Met Gala’s red carpet with the iconic nude mesh dress Marilyn Monroe wore when she sang “Happy Birthday, Mr. President” to John F. Kennedy.】

item.title: 千禧年、Point72 和 Citadel 是比特币 ETF 的买家之一
item.description: 说到比特币 ETF，投身其中的不仅仅是零售交易人群。现在很明显，对冲基金、养老基金和银行在比特币交易所交易基金经历了十多年的酝酿之后，也将资金投入到了比特币交易所交易基金中。【原文：When it comes to Bitcoin ETFs, it’s not just the retail trading crowd that’s taking the plunge. It’s now clear that hedge funds, pension funds and banks have also sprinkled capital into the exchange-traded funds after their blockbuster debut that was more than a decade in the making.】

item.title: Azul 首席执行官称 M&A 是拉丁美洲陷入困境的航空公司的救命稻草
item.description: Azul SA 首席执行官约翰-彼得-罗德格森表示，合并将降低拉丁美洲航空公司的资本成本，从而为客户提供更好的服务。【原文：Consolidation would lower the cost of capital for Latin American airlines, resulting in better services for customers, according to Azul SA Chief Executive Officer John Peter Rodgerson.】

item.title: 文艺复兴科技在反弹前大举买入 GameStop 和 AMC
item.description: 由已故吉姆-西蒙斯（Jim Simons）创立的量化基金文艺复兴科技有限责任公司（Renaissance Technologies LLC）在最近一次反弹之前，大举买入了记忆类股票的宠儿 AMC Entertainment Holdings Inc.【原文：Renaissance Technologies LLC, the quantitative fund founded by the late Jim Simons, loaded up on shares of meme-stock darlings AMC Entertainment Holdings Inc. and GameStop Corp. ahead of the latest rally.】

item.title: 美联储巴尔就推迟提出银行奖金规定一事接受采访
item.description: 美国参议员伊丽莎白-沃伦（Elizabeth Warren）向美联储负责监管的副主席询问，他是否会效仿其他监管机构的做法，强制银行从承担过多风险的高管那里收回部分薪酬。【原文：US Senator Elizabeth Warren pushed the Federal Reserve’s vice chair for supervision on whether he would follow other regulators’ lead on a plan to force banks to claw back some pay from executives taking on too much risk.】

item.title: 卢拉推动巴西国家石油公司新任首席执行官促进炼油厂和天然气投资
item.description: 巴西总统路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦（Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva）在将巴西国家石油公司（Petroleo Brasileiro SA）首席执行官赶下台后，将推动该公司的新掌门人加快对炼油厂的投资步伐，并扩大天然气供应。【原文：Brazil President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva will push the new head of Petroleo Brasileiro SA to speed the pace of investments into refineries and expand its natural gas supplies after ousting the state-run oil company’s chief executive officer, people familiar with his plans said.】

item.title: 研究称，特鲁多推动住房建设的努力受到生产力薄弱的挑战
item.description: 据国家住房机构称，加拿大拥有每年多建造 70% 房屋所需的工人，而市政繁文缛节则是建造房屋的主要障碍。【原文：Canada has the workers it needs to build 70% more homes a year and municipal red tape is the main barrier to construction, according to the nation’s housing agency.】

item.title: 美国抵押贷款利率连续两周下降，降至 7.02
item.description: 美国的抵押贷款利率进一步放缓，减轻了购房者在艰难的美国房地产市场中前进的压力。【原文：Mortgage rates in the US eased further, relieving some pressure on buyers forging ahead in a tough US housing market.】

item.title: 美国电力生产商将在 2035 年前将发电量提高 80
item.description: 根据 BloombergNEF 的数据，预计到 2035 年，美国的总发电能力将提高 80%，这主要得益于近 1 兆瓦的新增太阳能和风能发电能力。【原文：The US is expected to boost total generating capacity by 80% through 2035, driven largely by almost 1 terawatt of new solar and wind, according to BloombergNEF.】

item.title: Robinhood 的加密货币交易量下跌速度超过竞争对手的交易所
item.description: 由于散户投资者对数字资产的偏好降温，罗宾汉市场公司（Robinhood Markets Inc.【原文：Crypto trading volumes recorded on Robinhood Markets Inc. more than halved in April, outpacing the decline seen on rival exchanges as digital-asset appetite among retail investors cooled.】

item.title: 私人信贷巨头包下中东航班追逐数十亿美元
item.description: 在一架从阿布扎比飞来的航班上，头等舱里挤满了私人信贷界的名人：阿波罗全球管理公司的约翰-齐托（John Zito）、蓝猫头鹰资本公司的道格-奥斯特罗弗（Doug Ostrover）、第六街合伙公司的乔希-伊斯特里（Josh Easterly）和对冲基金经理杰森-穆德里克（Jason Mudrick）。【原文：Jostling for space in the first-class cabin of a flight from Abu Dhabi was a who’s-who of the private credit world: Apollo Global Management Inc.’s John Zito, Blue Owl Capital Inc.’s Doug Ostrover, Sixth Street Partners’ Josh Easterly and hedge fund manager Jason Mudrick.】

item.title: 南非敦促联合国法院阻止以色列 "摧毁加沙
item.description: 南非向联合国法庭提交了一起种族灭绝案件，南非认为，国际法院必须采取更大胆的行动，迫使以色列保护加沙的平民。【原文：The International Court of Justice must take bolder action to make Israel protect civilians in Gaza, according to South Africa, which has brought a genocide case before the United Nations tribunal.】

item.title: Peconic 对冲基金连战连捷，2024 年收益率达 18
item.description: 新年伊始，比尔-哈尼施（Bill Harnisch）对股票持谨慎态度。但这并不妨碍他的 18 亿美元对冲基金在强劲的反弹中取得傲视市场的回报。【原文：Bill Harnisch came into the new year with a cautious view on equities. That hasn’t kept his $1.8 billion hedge fund from delivering a market-beating return in the face of a formidable rally.】

item.title: 简街公司被勒令详述秘密印度交易策略
item.description: Jane Street Group 被命令向监督此案的曼哈顿联邦法官详细说明其指控的两名前交易员在千禧管理公司（Millennium Management）的新工作中采取的印度期权秘密策略。【原文：Jane Street Group was ordered to detail the secret Indian options strategy it alleges two former traders took to their new jobs at Millennium Management to the Manhattan federal judge overseeing the case.】

item.title: 银行信托部门管理的基金受到美国证券交易委员会的审查
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会主席加里-根斯勒（Gary Gensler）周四表示，美国最高监管机构正在推进一项加强对银行信托部门管理的投资基金监督的计划。【原文：Top US regulators are pushing ahead with a bid to boost oversight of investment funds managed by bank trust departments, Securities and Exchange Commission Chair Gary Gensler said Thursday.】

item.title: 汇丰银行第一大股东中国平安正在探索削减 130 亿美元股份的方法
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，平安保险集团股份有限公司（Ping An Insurance Group Co.【原文：Ping An Insurance Group Co. is weighing options that would allow it to reduce its 8% stake in HSBC Holdings Plc, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 雪佛龙出售英国克莱尔油田，退出北海市场
item.description: 雪佛龙公司将其在英国克莱尔油田的股份出售，此举标志着这家美国超级巨头在半个多世纪后退出北海。【原文：Chevron Corp. put its stake in the UK’s Clair oilfield up for sale in a move that will mark the US supermajor’s exit from the North Sea after more than half a century.】

item.title: 石油管道爆裂引发南苏丹暴力和经济崩溃的风险
item.description: 据国际危机组织（International Crisis Group）称，南苏丹约三分之二的原油出口管道破裂，如果不紧急修复，可能会加剧这个世界上最新成立的国家战火重燃的风险。【原文：A broken pipeline that exports about two-thirds of South Sudan’s crude production could heighten the risk of renewed fighting in the world’s newest nation if not repaired urgently, according to the International Crisis Group.】

item.title: 软着陆岛 "以 "无忧无虑 "的视角吸引着贸易商的目光
item.description:
施瓦布对美联储所希望的经济表现的看法："它在降温，但并不酷。【原文：

The view at Schwab on an economy behaving as the Fed wants: ‘It’s cooling, it’s not cool.’

】

item.title: 我们从 "备忘录股票 "续集中学到了什么？
item.description: 本周，华尔街迎来了 "我们又来了 "的时刻，meme 股的亢奋情绪突然卷土重来。为期两天的反弹让投资者再次涌入这批在大流行病期间飙升的股票，当时个人在社交媒体上联手押注做空对冲基金。然而，现在的情况与 2021 年时大不相同，当时散户们可以用低利率、良性通胀和电子商务的迅猛发展来证明估值过高的合理性。下面是【原文：Wall Street had a here-we-go-again moment this week, with the sudden return of meme stock euphoria. A two-day rally led investors to rush back into a group of stocks that soared during the pandemic, when individuals teamed up across social media to bet against short-selling hedge funds. Yet things look very different than they did in 2021, when the retail crowd could point to rock-bottom interest rates, benign inflation and surging e-commerce to help justify the stratospheric valuations. Here ar】

item.title: 高盛为 UPS 养老基金达成 430 亿美元投资协议
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc. clinched a $43 billion mandate to invest pension fund assets of parcel-delivery company UPS, in one of the largest deals of its kind.】

item.title: 外国投资者以 2013 年以来最快速度涌入土耳其债券市场
item.description: 海外投资者正在以十多年来最快的速度购买土耳其政府债券，因为他们对货币正统性和降低通胀率的承诺令他们胆战心惊。【原文：Overseas investors are buying Turkish government bonds at the fastest pace in more than a decade, emboldened by pledges of monetary orthodoxy and lower inflation.】

item.title: 普京与习近平的 "暧昧关系 "解析
item.description: 中俄两国数百年来一直是竞争对手，现在却结成了事实上的联盟，尽管还没有达到习近平主席和普京总统在2022年2月俄罗斯入侵乌克兰前几周刚刚设定的 "无限制 "的高标准。这两个世界上最强大的独裁国家在过去十年间建立了经济、军事和政治联系，其目的至少是要颠覆美国主导的冷战后秩序的一部分。【原文：Rivals for centuries, China and Russia now have a de facto alliance, even if it’s failed to reach the high, “no limits” bar that Presidents Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin set just weeks before Russia’s invasion of Ukraine in February 2022. The economic, military and political ties nurtured over the past decade between the world’s two most powerful authoritarian states — both of which aim to upend at least parts of the US-dominated, post-Cold War order — have grown as a result of the war, despite】
